question: [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/Types/Round.cs] [CheckRoundTimeSlots] [Two Miners Edge] With exactly 2 miners, loop only checks first pair - can the second miner's interval be arbitrarily large without validation? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/Types/Round.cs] [GetMiningInterval] [Order Gap] If no miners have Order 1 or 2 (e.g., orders start at 3), Where clause returns empty list causing index exception on firstTwoMiners[1]? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/Types/Round.cs] [IsTimeSlotPassed] [Boundary Timestamp] At exact boundary where ExpectedMiningTime + Duration equals currentBlockTime, is comparison < or <=? Can miner exploit boundary to double-mine? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/Types/Round.cs] [GetExtraBlockMiningTime] [All Same Order] If all miners have Order = 1, which is considered 'last'? Can this cause unpredictable extra block timing? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/Types/Round.cs] [GetMinedBlocks] [Long.MaxValue Sum] If total ProducedBlocks across all miners exceeds long.MaxValue, does Sum overflow to negative, breaking block count accounting? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/Types/Round.cs] [NeedToChangeTerm] [Zero MinersCountOfConsent] If MinersCountOfConsent is 0, any count >= 0 triggers term change - can this cause term changes on every block? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/Types/Round.cs] [IsTimeToChangeTerm] [Timestamp Before Start] If blockProducedTimestamp < blockchainStartTimestamp, subtraction is negative - can negative Seconds break Div operation? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/Types/Round.cs] [GetExpectedMiningTime] [MaxValue Arithmetic] If code adds durations to returned long.MaxValue timestamp, does it overflow to negative values? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/Types/Round.cs] [FirstActualMiner] [All Null OutValue] If no miner has set OutValue, function returns null - can this cause null reference when code assumes FirstActualMiner always exists? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/Types/Round.cs] [RealTimeMinersInformation] [Concurrent Modification] If RealTimeMinersInformation is modified during enumeration in any function, can InvalidOperationException halt consensus? (High)
